data.title: 90 Years of the Soul of American Culture
data.meta_description: Welcome to the Apollo Theater and join us to celebrate 90 years of music, art and theater at the Soul of American Culture on 125th Street of Harlem, NYC.
data.text:
A new season of Apolloâs signature series returns! Known as one of New Yorkâs most popular live entertainment experiences, Amateur Night at The Apollo attracts performers and audiences from around the world in a classic talent competition that has launched the careers of countless legendary artists, from Ella Fitzgerald, Luther Vandross, Lauryn Hill, H.E.R, Machine Gun Kelly, Jazmine Sullivan and more.Â

Â

Join the fun with the weekly classic competition that sheds light on the careers of a whole new roster of stars. Be a part of the notoriously âtoughâ audience in an interactive evening unlike any other and lend your voice to decide who will âBe Good or Be Gone!â to win the triumphant grand prize.Â

â

Amateur Night at The Apollo sponsored by Coca-Cola,Â is hosted by the comedian Capone. Each show begins with a festive pre-party featuring video and music by DJ Jess and Set It Off Man Greginald Spencer. Keep a lookout for C.P. Lacey, the resident Executioner who sweeps bad talent off the stage!

â

Join The Apollo as it welcomes The Princess of Amapiano, Uncle Waffles. Making her Apollo debut, this show is one for the culture! We're expecting the Swaziland superstar and internationally acclaimed DJ to LIGHT IT UP!

â

Get your tickets before they're gone for this FREE once in a lifetime performance presented by Coca-Cola.

Be a part of the notoriously âtoughâ audience in an interactive evening unlike any other and lend your voice to decide who will âBe Good or Be Gone!â to win the triumphant grand prize.Â

â

Amateur Night at The Apollo sponsored by Coca-Cola,Â is hosted by the comedian Capone. Each show begins with a festive pre-party featuring video and music by DJ Jess and Set It Off Man Greginald Spencer. Keep a lookout for C.P. Lacey, the resident Executioner who sweeps bad talent off the stage!

This Labor Day Weekend, The King of Soca, Machel Montano brings Carnival to Harlem! Bring your friends, family, and loved ones for the ultimate celebration of music, culture, and community.

â

From his chart-topping hits to his infectious energy, Machel Montano knows how to throw a party like no other. Join The Apollo this Labor Day weekend for the hottest celebration of music, culture, and community, hosted by Dahved Levy to keep us ROCKIN' and opening with a set by DJ Hard Hittin' Harry.

â

This event is currently sold out. Join the waitlist to be among the first to know if additional tickets are released for sale.

â

Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson kicks off her memoir, Lovely One, on the most iconic stage in the world. Donât miss this history-making event as the first Black woman elected to the United States Supreme Court shares the wisdom behind her incredible career and journey to the Supreme Court.

â

A limited number of signed books will be available with ticket purchase. Select Book + Ticket to purchase a book and ticket bundle.

â

âIn Conversation: Ketanji Brown Jackson is part of The Apolloâs Fall/Winter 2024 season.

This September, Apollo Education convenes educators, cultural workers, administrators, and teaching artists to explore the meaning, preservation, and future of teaching and learning through the lens of Black diasporic arts and culture.

â

A dynamic day of conversations and workshops will create a vibrant and generative space that centers Black arts and culture within broader curricular and pedagogical frameworks in both K-12 and higher education.Â

â

Don't miss this unique opportunity to engage with innovative ideas, share best practices, and contribute to the evolution of education that honors and elevates Black cultural heritage. Join The Apollo and be part of a powerful movement shaping the future of education.

â
